text: Tripoli (Formal / ALA-LC: Ṭarābulus; Lebanese Arabic: Ṭrāblus; / Tripolis) is the largest city in northern Lebanon and the second-largest city in Lebanon. It is the capital of the North Governorate and the Tripoli District. It has the second largest port in Lebanon. About 80 percent of the people who live in the city are Sunni Muslims, as well as Alawite Muslims (approximately 15%), and a small percentage of Orthodox and Maronite Christians (approximately 5%). ==Notes== == References == == Other websites == Category:Cities in Lebanon Category:Phoenician colonies
title: Tripoli, Lebanon
